name: Ode to the Minotaur - Ωδή στον Μινώταυρο
name_original: Ode to the Minotaur - Ωδή στον Μινώταυρο
description:
Made for the Thessaloniki Queer Arts Festival:

https://queerartsfestival.gr/

You play as Sphinx near the top of Mount Olympus, but the way is blocked by a giant Minotaur. Sphinx just wants to get past the Minotaur, but the Minotaur keeps slappin' em away. Eventually, playing as Sphinx,  you will make friends across five/six different puzzles in order to try and get past the Minotaur.

The game is currently in a demo phase, with a great emphasis on aesthetic. I tried to create a really unique representation of our assumptions of the Ancient Greek atmosphere by putting my own twist to it. The aim is to eventually create a non-dialogue based narrative/puzzle game in order to ensure the game is accessible across multiple languages. 

Right now there's no real major puzzles, just some environmental things that can occur. You can wander around, and it's pretty, but there's still a lot to add. Gotta do some shader stuff, too.

Controls:

  • 'R' to reset
  • 'Esc' to leave
  • 'Shift' to run
  • 'W,A,S,D' for the whole walking thing
